                                          Class<T> serviceType)

      • asyncWaitForService

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> asyncWaitForService(Class<T> serviceType)
        Asynchronously waits for the service with the given type to be available. Immediately returns a Future object that can be used to get the service later. ATTENTION: The future may run infinitely if the service is not available at all. Use Future.get(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) if you want to limit the time to wait.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type
        Parameters:
        serviceType - the service type
        Returns:
        a future that will eventually contain the service instance

      • getClassesFromPackage

        public static Class<?>[] getClassesFromPackage(Class<?> one)
                                        throws ClassNotFoundException
        Returns all classes from a package
        Parameters:
        one - a well known class from the package that should be searched
        Returns:
        the found classes (never returns null)
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if one of the classes from the package could not be loaded

      • getClassesFromPackage

        public static <T> Class<? extends T>[] getClassesFromPackage(Class<?> one,
                                                             Class<T> base)
                                                      throws ClassNotFoundException
        Searches a package and returns all classes that extend or implement the given class or interface.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the class or interface the returned classes should extend or implement
        Parameters:
        one - a well known class from the package that should be searched
        base - a class or an interface the returned classes should extend or implement
        Returns:
        the found classes (never returns null)
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if one of the classes from the package could not be loaded

      • getClassesFromPackage

        public static Class<?>[] getClassesFromPackage(String pkg,
                                               org.osgi.framework.Bundle bnd)
                                        throws ClassNotFoundException
        Returns all classes from a package
        Parameters:
        pkg - the package to search for classes
        bnd - the bundle which contains the package
        Returns:
        the found classes (never returns null)
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if one of the classes from the package could not be loaded

      • getClassesFromPackage

        public static <T> Class<? extends T>[] getClassesFromPackage(String pkg,
                                                             org.osgi.framework.Bundle bnd,
                                                             Class<T> base)
                                                      throws ClassNotFoundException
        Searches a package and returns all classes that extend or implement the given class or interface.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the class or interface the returned classes should extend or implement
        Parameters:
        pkg - the package to search for classes
        bnd - the bundle which contains the package
        base - a class or an interface the returned classes should extend or implement
        Returns:
        the found classes (never returns null)
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if one of the classes from the package could not be loaded

      • getClassesFromPackage

        public static <T> Class<? extends T>[] getClassesFromPackage(String pkg,
                                                             JarFile jar,
                                                             Class<T> base)
                                                      throws ClassNotFoundException
        Searches a package and returns all classes that extend or implement the given class or interface.
        Parameters:
        pkg - the package to search for classes
        jar - the jar file which contains the package
        base - a class or an interface the returned classes should extend or implement
        Returns:
        the found classes (never returns null)
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if one of the classes from the package could not be loaded

        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type
        Parameters:
        serviceType - the service type
        Returns:
        the available service of this type or null

                                 String preferredBundleName,
                                 String className)
        Load a class from the given bundles
        Parameters:
        bundles - the bundles
        preferredBundleName - the symbolic name of the preferred bundle (can be null)
        className - the class name
        Returns:
        the loaded class or null

      • loadClass

        public static Class<?> loadClass(String name,
                                 String preferredBundleName)
        Load the class with the given name. The class will be loaded from the OSGi context if it is available
        Parameters:
        name - the class name
        preferredBundleName - the symbolic name of the preferred bundle (can be null)
        Returns:
        the loaded class or null

      • waitForService

        public static <T> T waitForService(Class<T> serviceType)
        Infinitely waits for the service with the given type to be available and then returns it. Only use the returned instance while you are sure it is still valid. ATTENTION: Please be absolute sure what you are doing before calling this method, since it uses an infinite loop internally.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type
        Parameters:
        serviceType - the service type
        Returns:
        the service or null if the timeout has occurred

      • waitForService

        public static <T> T waitForService(Class<T> serviceType,
                                   int timeout)
        Waits for the service with the given type to be available and then returns it. Only use the returned instance while you are sure it is still valid.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type
        Parameters:
        serviceType - the service type
        timeout - the timeout in seconds after which to return even if the service is not available
        Returns:
        the service or null if the timeout has occurred

      • waitUntil

        public static boolean waitUntil(OsgiUtils.Condition condition)
        Wait infinitely until the condition is true, the condition will be checked every second ATTENTION: Please be absolute sure what you are doing before calling this method, since it uses an infinite loop internally.
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition
        Returns:
        the condition value

      • waitUntil

        public static boolean waitUntil(OsgiUtils.Condition condition,
                                int timeout)
        Wait until the condition is true, the condition will be checked every second
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition
        timeout - the timeout in seconds after which to return even if the condition is false
        Returns:
        the condition value
